question.text: Crossing over takes place between which chromatids and in which stage of the cell cycle?

options.text: Non-sister chromatids of non-homologous chromosomes at zygotene stage of prophase I
Non-sister chromatids of homologous chromosomes at pachytene stage of prophase I
Non-sister chromatids of homologous chromosomes at zygotene stage of prophase I
Non-sister chromatids of non-homologous chromosomes at pachytene stage of prophase I

solution.text: Crossing over takes place between non-sister chromatids of homologous chromosomes at pachytene stage of prophase-I. This stage of prophase- $\mathrm{I}$ in meiosis is characterised by the appearance of recombination nodules, the site at which crossing over occurs between non-sister chromatids of the homologous chromosomes.
